criteria: Can efficiently manipulate large datasets using pandas (groupby, merge, pivot) and other Python data libraries
Can design and implement classes in Python using OOP principles and apply common design patterns (Factory, Singleton, etc.)
Can create and manage asynchronous tasks using asyncio and async/await for high-concurrency applications
Can leverage built-in functions (map, filter, reduce) and comprehensions for cleaner, more efficient code
Can implement robust exception handling and use Python debugging tools (pdb, logging) effectively
Can profile Python code (using cProfile, line_profiler) and optimize bottlenecks for better performance
Can manage environments and dependencies with pip, conda, or Poetry
Can write unit and integration tests using pytest or unittest, including mocking and coverage
Can write clear docstrings (Google or NumPy style), generate Sphinx docs, and use type hints for maintainability
Can use dplyr, tidyr, and other tidyverse tools for efficient data wrangling
Can perform descriptive and inferential statistics using base R, stats, and other packages
Can create sophisticated plots with ggplot2 using the grammar of graphics
Can produce reproducible reports, dashboards, and presentations with R Markdown and Shiny
Understands strategies for parallel computing (e.g., parallel, foreach) to speed up R workflows
Understands Java collections, concurrency utilities, and I/O classes for building robust applications
Can design and use generic classes and methods for type-safe reusable components
Can write thread-safe code using synchronized blocks, locks, and concurrent data structures
Can manage project builds and dependencies with Maven or Gradle
Writes comprehensive tests using JUnit or TestNG, including parameterized tests and coverage analysis
Understands Spring Boot for building RESTful services and dependency injection mechanisms
Can efficiently select and manipulate DOM elements using vanilla JavaScript or frameworks
Understands modern JavaScript syntax (arrow functions, destructuring, modules) and applies best practices
Uses callbacks, Promises, and async/await for non-blocking operations
Builds server-side applications, handles routing, and manages packages via npm or Yarn
Arranges charts, legends, and text for optimal information hierarchy
Ensures colorblind-friendly palettes and adequate text readability
Can identify, visualize, and apply appropriate probability distributions
Understands Bayesian inference, prior/posterior distributions, and can perform Bayesian updating
Implements random sampling to simulate complex systems and estimate probabilities
Performs t-tests, ANOVA, and regression-based hypothesis tests
Applies rank-based and other non-parametric methods when assumptions are violated
Adjusts for multiple comparisons (Bonferroni, FDR) in large-scale experiments
Designs experiments with control/treatment groups and adequate power analysis
Plans factorial or fractional factorial experiments to assess interactions
Builds and interprets linear models, checking assumptions and diagnostic plots
Models binary outcomes and interprets odds ratios and classification metrics
Handles hierarchical data with random effects to account for nested structures
Can identify ARIMA orders, fit models, and evaluate forecast accuracy
Detects and models seasonal patterns with appropriate decomposition methods
Tests for stationarity (ADF/KPSS) and applies transformations (differencing) if needed
Implements and evaluates classifiers (Logistic Regression, Decision Trees, SVM, etc.)
Builds and tunes regression models (Linear, Ridge, Lasso, etc.)
Creates domain-relevant features and applies selection or dimensionality reduction
Uses k-fold, stratified, or nested CV to optimize and compare models
Implements random forests, gradient boosting, or stacking for improved accuracy
Applies K-means, Hierarchical, DBSCAN, or similar methods to discover patterns
Uses PCA, t-SNE, or UMAP to visualize or reduce high-dimensional data
Detects outliers using isolation forests, local outlier factor, or robust statistics
Selects and interprets metrics (precision, recall, RMSE, MAE, AUC, etc.)
Chooses appropriate train/test splits, time-based splits, or nested CV for robust evaluation
Investigates misclassifications or residuals to refine data features or modeling approach
Packages and serves models via REST APIs, containers, or serverless functions
Implements model drift detection, data quality checks, and automated retraining
Maintains code, data, and model versioning (Git, DVC, MLflow) for reproducibility
Designs feed-forward networks, autoencoders, or specialized architectures
Builds CNNs for image recognition, segmentation, or object detection
Implements RNNs, LSTM, or GRU for sequence data
Works with attention mechanisms for NLP or vision tasks (BERT, GPT, Vision Transformers)
Writes custom training loops or uses high-level APIs for building and tuning models
Builds computation graphs or uses Keras to prototype and deploy deep learning models
Utilizes GPU acceleration and memory optimization for large-scale training
Leverages grid/random search or Bayesian optimization for model improvement
Adapts pre-trained models to new tasks for faster convergence and reduced data needs
Writes SELECT statements with proper aliases, filtering (WHERE), and ordering (ORDER BY)
Incorporates conditional logic in queries to handle complex data transformations
Aggregates data with GROUP BY and filters groups using HAVING clauses
Performs INNER, LEFT, RIGHT, FULL joins to combine tables accurately
Utilizes functions like RANK(), ROW_NUMBER(), LAG/LEAD for advanced analytical queries
Creates and manages indexes to improve query performance; understands query plans
Can design normalized schemas (1NF, 2NF, 3NF) to avoid data anomalies and redundancies
Understands ACID properties, locking mechanisms, and isolation levels
Works with document-based data, designs schemas, and uses aggregation pipelines
Understands wide-column storage, partition keys, and efficient data modeling
Can load, transform, and query massive datasets efficiently in Snowflake
Builds scalable analytics queries in GCP's serverless data warehouse
Writes PySpark or Scala code to process large datasets in a distributed manner
Understands HDFS, MapReduce, and the broader Hadoop ecosystem (Hive, Pig)
Implements data pipelines with real-time frameworks (Kafka, Flink, Spark Streaming)
Uses AWS EMR, Glue, or Kinesis for big data and analytics workflows
Leverages Dataflow, Pub/Sub, or Dataproc for scalable data processing
Implements big data solutions with Azure HDInsight, Data Factory, or Synapse
Understands trade-offs between service decomposition and monolithic architectures
Designs decoupled systems with queues, pub/sub mechanisms, and asynchronous flows
Creates well-versioned, documented APIs with clean resource structures
Identifies potential bottlenecks and applies horizontal/vertical scaling strategies
Implements replication, failover, and redundancy to ensure minimal downtime
Sets up automated builds, tests, and deployments using Jenkins, GitHub Actions, or GitLab CI
Builds and manages Docker images, understands multi-stage builds, and container security
Deploys and scales microservices on Kubernetes, configures pods, services, and ingresses
Defines and provisions infrastructure across cloud providers with Terraform modules
Uses Prometheus, Grafana, or ELK stack to track performance and troubleshoot issues
Verifies individual components or functions in isolation
Ensures multiple components interact correctly in a cohesive system
Simulates user workflows to validate the entire product flow
Measures application throughput and behavior under high concurrency
Writes tests before code (TDD) or uses user stories (BDD) to guide development
Ensures each module/class has a single, clear purpose
Understands extension without modification and proper subclassing behavior
Knows patterns like Factory, Builder, Adapter, and Proxy for reuse and flexibility
Can clean up and restructure outdated codebases for better maintainability
Understands core AWS offerings (EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda) and security best practices
Familiar with Azure VMs, App Services, Azure DevOps, and monitoring tools
Uses Google Compute Engine, Cloud Run, Cloud Storage, and IAM for secure deployments
Knows common web vulnerabilities and how to mitigate them (SQL Injection, XSS, CSRF)
Implements secure token-based authentication and role-based access control
Applies SSL/TLS for network security and uses encryption libraries or services for stored data
Produces clear documentation, specs, and knowledge base articles
Summarizes findings or project updates in concise, data-driven reports
Delivers engaging presentations with clear objectives and audience focus
Communicates timelines, risks, and resource needs with business or client stakeholders
Provides constructive feedback, adheres to coding standards, and fosters collective ownership
Collaborates in real-time to share expertise and maintain code quality
Understands sprint planning, daily stand-ups, backlog grooming, and retrospectives
Uses tools (e.g., JMeter, cProfile, New Relic) to identify performance bottlenecks
Implements in-memory caches (Redis) or edge caching (Cloudflare) to reduce latency
Conducts load/stress tests to ensure the system meets performance SLAs
Defines a clear product vision aligned with business objectives and user needs
Evaluates market trends, competitor offerings, and potential gaps for product growth
Investigates pricing strategies (subscription, freemium) and tests monetization hypotheses
Designs unbiased surveys and conducts interviews to gather user pain points and desires
Sets up user testing sessions and iterates designs based on feedback
Creates detailed personas to guide feature prioritization and communication
Defines KPIs (e.g., MAU, churn, LTV) and monitors them for continuous product improvement
Formulates hypotheses, sets up experiments, and interprets statistical significance
Segments users by cohort to uncover usage patterns and product adoption trends
Inspires teams, fosters psychological safety, and drives engagement
Navigates disagreements and finds common ground to keep teams productive
Balances data, intuition, and stakeholder input to make timely, effective decisions
Estimates market size and identifies viable segments for product expansion
Researches willingness-to-pay and competitive pricing to optimize revenue
Coordinates cross-functional launch activities, ensuring product readiness and marketing alignment
Maintains a backlog reflecting business impact, user value, and technical feasibility
Documents user stories with clear, testable acceptance criteria
Schedules releases with clear scope, dependencies, and communication plans
Uses tools (Figma, Sketch) to create and iterate on interface concepts
Ensures compliance with accessibility guidelines for all users
Organizes content and navigation flows for intuitive user experiences
Identifies core business challenges and reframes them into clear technical or data questions
Keeps updated on industry trends, emerging technologies, and competitor offerings
Defines success criteria, tracks ROI, and correlates product outcomes to business goals
Facilitates regular updates to executive teams, ensuring transparency and alignment
Uses MLflow or Weights & Biases to log parameters, metrics, and artifacts for reproducible experiments
Optimizes neural networks for edge or low-resource environments through quantization and pruning
Implements ACID transactions on data lakes, enabling reliable data pipelines at scale
Maintains consistent training/serving features with tools like Feast or Tecton
Builds event-driven ML or data pipelines using AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions, or Azure Functions
Uses dbt for modular SQL transformations, version control, and testing within analytics workflows
Uses Neptune.ai or Comet.ml for shared experiment dashboards and artifact versioning
Creates standardized model documentation outlining performance, limitations, and ethical considerations
Implements micro-frontend architectures using Module Federation or single-spa for large-scale web apps
Leverages WebAssembly for performance-critical modules within browser environments
Configures SonarQube, Checkmarx, or similar solutions in CI/CD for static/dynamic security testing

competency: HashiCorp Vault or AWS Secrets Manager
criteria: Safely stores and rotates credentials, API keys, and database passwords
Uses Open Policy Agent (OPA) or similar to enforce security and compliance policies in IaC pipelines
Implements sidecars in Kubernetes for service mesh, logging, or security proxies (e.g., Istio)
Uses Jaeger or OpenTelemetry to trace requests across microservices for root cause analysis
Optimizes database performance with proper pooling configurations and cache invalidation strategies
Facilitates post-incident reviews focusing on systemic improvements rather than individual blame
Uses tools like Gremlin or Chaos Monkey to inject failures and improve system robustness
Effectively uses GitHub Copilot or CodeWhisperer while verifying AI-suggested code for correctness
Applies toolkits like AI Fairness 360 to detect and mitigate algorithmic bias
Understands OpenAPI/Swagger specs and collaborates on clear, stable API contracts
Authors ADRs to capture context and trade-offs behind significant technical decisions
Configures and manages Optimizely, LaunchDarkly, or Statsig for controlled experiments
Aligns product initiatives with overarching objectives and key results
Analyzes usage patterns to design scalable pay-as-you-go or consumption-based models
Ensures data handling, consent, and privacy features align with global regulations
Conducts JTBD interviews to pinpoint core user needs and motivations
Designs conjoint studies to measure feature trade-offs and pricing sensitivity
Adheres to latest accessibility guidelines, ensuring inclusive design for diverse user needs
Uses product analytics platforms for funnel analysis, retention tracking, and user segmentation
